website_summaries.verdict: Artistically designed iron pan enables the creation of the perfect omelette.
pros: We also love that there are no harmful coatings on the pan
Handle is made so it doesn't get too hot
cons: The size is a tad small

customer_reviews.title: A very good pan is inciting hostility
customer_reviews.text: the instructions are written in Japanese. It would contribute to world peace if there was an English version included
customer_reviews.author: mr Richard

customer_reviews.title: This pan is cast iron perfection!
customer_reviews.text: I hardly ever write reviews despite being (probably ha!) one of Amazon's most frequent customer. My cookware consists of a lot of cast iron, a few carbon steel and a little more than a few quality copper pieces. I followed the included seasoning instructions to a T instead of my typical cast iron seasoning routine. First use I made a bacon egg and cheese croissant sandwich using this pan. Lightly toasted the croissant over medium heat in the pan. Then cooked bacon in the pan and finally made an omelette in the bacon grease + a dab of butter. No sticking whatsoever! Zero. Beauty and function perfection is so rare these days. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: WalkingHorse

customer_reviews.title: Most amazing omelet pan ever
customer_reviews.text: The most amazing pan I have ever used. Absolutely perfect condition out of the box and it cooks beautifully, we basically use it for everything now. Completely spoiled for any other stovetop frypan. My only wish is that the company made larger versions with deeper sides.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Not non-stick, sorry to say.
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing this review to save someone else some money. I never write negative reviews unless they are real. This pan is simply not nonstick and it’s not good for eggs, unless of course you use way too much butter or oil. With a normal amount of either of these eggs stick badly as you can see below. I sprayed this pan with olive oil before cooking and this is what I got. I bought this trying to get away from Teflon, but it is no where’s near as good for eggs
customer_reviews.author: avldreamer

customer_reviews.title: Best iron skillet for eggs you’ll ever find
customer_reviews.text: I love eggs so I wanted to buy a pan devoted to eggs. Once you get the oil really hot you crack the eggs and they practically slide off once they are done because the edges are rounded. Brilliant design
customer_reviews.author: Esther K.

customer_reviews.title: Best omellete pan ever
customer_reviews.text: Every omellette is fluffy and perfect. Ive made a million omelettes... the ones made on this pan are better. you get what you pay for. Easy to clean, looks nice out on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Alex V

customer_reviews.title: Great cast iron pans
customer_reviews.text: Not for omelets... in my opinion but great for a cast iron pan. Light weight (comparatively) easy to clean and rugged. I use them for searing and then throw the pan into the oven to finish the cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Omelette Pan yet
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, pan was well seasoned and very non-stick. Great pan for eggs over-easy or omelette. The pans cool handle and shape helps to get eggs sliding around, and then flip eggs like a pro. Handle stays cool unlike Lodge pan. Works great on Induction Range.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful pan.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely nonstick right out of the box. Keep it clean, dry and well oiled it should last the rest of your life. Never going back to Teflon.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan
customer_reviews.text: Great little cast iron pan. I like the way that the sides have a gentle sloping edge unlike the hard edge you find on most pans like this. Stays naturally non-stick if you season it first and treat it right.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Iwachu love😍
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike about this omelette skillet!!! Love the 24cm/medium size. Decided to go bigger after reading reviews wishing they had bought the larger size. Cooked my salmon perfectly. It barely needs any oil, as instructed. Love love this artsy skillet. The cost has officially been justified.😁
customer_reviews.author: Chantelle LMT

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, a bad fit
customer_reviews.text: This pan is gorgeous. Beautifully sloped interior. However, the surface of my pan was quite rough and I was looking for a smooth interior for making omelettes. I didn't use it, but I couldn't see how eggs wouldn't stick. Also, the handle, while very beautiful, was too wide for me and felt clumsy. I wear women's size large in gloves. I really hated returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Mare

customer_reviews.title: Love these skillets!!!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the small iwachu skillet so well I wanted the large for an even better experience cooking my omelettes. These iwachu pans are the best and easiest to use. My omelettes came out perfect every time. I use the small one for sautéed peppers, mushrooms, and onions for my omelette. Pricey, yes, but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Sloan

customer_reviews.title: Value for money
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 10months now and I must say it’s the finest non-stick pan without any coating. So glad to have an alternative to all the dangerous chemicals. It’s still like new after good use over so many months. Good value for money
customer_reviews.author: infowise

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: Really good quality. Instructions for seasoning are in Japanese. Be sure to check online for instructions. If properly seasoned before use, it is nonstick.
customer_reviews.author: A Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best of all the cast iron skillets we own! It was nonstick right out of the box using very little butter. It is well worth the money! Handle stayed cool too with the unique design.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Great pan
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a four egg omelette. The finish is great, effectively non-stick, assuming that you follow the instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan A. Gunst

customer_reviews.title: Even though this is the larger size it is still small-medium
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, design and performance. Wish it also came in a bigger size
customer_reviews.author: Regular Buyer

customer_reviews.title: I like this pan and use it frequently
customer_reviews.text: I like this pan and use it frequently. It isn't too heavy. I do wish the surface was a bit more polished and smooth. That would help it be more non-stick. Also, it has some sort of a coating on it from the factory that wipes off black. I have not experienced this on non-pre seasoned pans. It might not be a bad thing, but I prefer cast iron that is not factory pre-seasoned.
customer_reviews.author: the_mad_reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Pan
customer_reviews.text: Can also be used as stir fry pan, size is right for family of two. Handle does not get hot while cooking, like it. I'd like to take down 0.5 point for mediocre packing, lucky it was not broken.
customer_reviews.author: CATSEYE

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this pan and use it almost everyday
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this pan and use it almost everyday. Omlettes come off the pan clean and perfect. I've enjoyed it so much I'm going to purchase several other Iwachu products. The handle does get very warm so recommend using a hot pan handle holder with it.
customer_reviews.author: ezekiel342

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight Cast Iron Pan
customer_reviews.text: Love this light weight cast iron pan. I use it for stir fry, pan fry, deep fry. The interior is lost smoother compare to other ones. The weight is lot lighter too. Although it takes sometime for the surface to be nonstick when I fry eggs.
customer_reviews.author: K. Chiew

customer_reviews.title: how to cook with cast iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought the pan mainly for making omlettes. Being a big user of cast iron, this pan is lighter and the shape is perfect. The trick is to heat the pan FIRST. Then add your butter, oil or combo to the pan. This insures the eggs, or anything else, will not stick. If you add oil to a cold cast iron pan you are asking for trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cast iron pan for eggs and everything else
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cast iron pan with a beautiful design. Eggs do not stick to it even from the first use. I'm glad I bought this large size over the medium one.
customer_reviews.author: DIANE L.

customer_reviews.title: Cast-Iron with Style
customer_reviews.text: A bit pricey, but this is a really nice cast iron pan. You lose some of the size with the gradually tapered sides, but it's perfect for omelets, scrambled eggs, etc. The handle still gets warm, but seems to not get quite as hot as some of my other cast iron pans.
customer_reviews.author: scottw

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful aesthetic and smooth operator
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pan that is a breeze to make omelettes or fried eggs with. Not sure what others mean by a coating being on this. Its a high quality forging with a smooth surface that is all cast iron. Its quite the looker on the stove too. Very nice to have a progressive curved edge vs the standard almost vertical style.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lehouillier

customer_reviews.title: Very nice. A bit smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. A bit smaller than expected. I have both the Large and the Medium Omelette pan, and I think the Medium is much too small for an Omelette if you want to fold anything into it. The Large is more nicely sized but honestly still a bit small for a 3 egg Omelette in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Indy Ray

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan!
customer_reviews.text: Not only will it be the coolest looking pan on your stove, but it's also super non-stick AND light weight!
customer_reviews.author: JPNC

customer_reviews.title: Great Cast Iron Pan!
customer_reviews.text: very nice, high quality cast iron pan. i really like the design of the handles, which have an open space down the middle to allow for air circulation and don't get nearly as hot as other cast iron handles. i'm impressed with the design and especially with the craftsmanship. the 'break in' period was simple. expensive and probably not worth it if you have to scrimp and save for a cast iron pan, but if you like to cook and can afford it, it hits the spot!
customer_reviews.author: grasspress

customer_reviews.title: wonderful pan, surface does not stick at all
customer_reviews.text: wonderful pan, surface does not stick at all, but it is important not to salt in the pan. Nevertheless the very slight mark after this mistake was easily removed with a bit of fat and tlc. Very recommendable
customer_reviews.author: Xenia Frahm

customer_reviews.title: NOT raw cast iron and not all that big, either
customer_reviews.text: Two big disappointments: (1) This pan has a coating -- I'm not sure what exactly, but likely some kind of silicate -- that scrapes off if used with metal utensils. (2) Although the rim diameter is 9.5", the slope to the bottom is so gradual that the capacity is only a little better than that of a standard omelet pan (unless you like thick omelets). The design is visually very pleasing, probably as elegant as any out there, but a $100 omelet pan has to get the details right, and this one really doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: planarian

customer_reviews.title: Love the shape.  Hate the surface.
customer_reviews.text: The pan is just too rough. We have many cast iron pans and griddles. This was by far the roughest. I seasoned 3x with flax oil and everything still stuck unless it was swimming in oil. So, I ground it smooth with a power sander. Now it works great. PS: Don't try this unless you have extra N95s or you will be inhaling iron dust, which is not a good idea.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Heats up quickly
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pan. Heats up quickly. Seasoning is wierd but its a grand omelette pan.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J. Munn

product_meta.title: Iwachu Iron Omelette Pan, Large
product_meta.description: Make delicious, fluffy omelettes every time using this Iwachu omelette pan. Cast iron has always been a favorite for cooking due to its ability to heat evenly and the pan's gently curved shape makes folding and plating an omelette super easy.
feature_bullets: Unique shape makes cooking an omelet easy
Heats evenly to prevent undercooking or burning
Specially formed handle does not get too hot

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars62 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
